text: Marvel Television was a subsidiary of Marvel Entertainment that created television series based on Marvel Comics. Founded in 2010, Marvel Television originally intended to expand the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) with television series including Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. (2013–2020), Daredevil (2015–2018), The Defenders (2017), and more. The subsidiary later expanded to create projects for the X-Men movie series and independent television series for Hulu. Marvel Television was folded into Marvel Studios in 2019 and its final projects aired in 2020 and 2021. == Production library == Series Aired Seasons Continuity Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. 2013–2020 7 Marvel Cinematic Universe Agent Carter 2015–2016 2 Daredevil 2015–2018 3 Jessica Jones 2015–2019 Luke Cage 2016–2018 2 Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.: Slingshot 2016 1 Legion 2017–2019 3 X-Men Iron Fist 2017–2018 2 Marvel Cinematic Universe The Defenders 2017 1 Inhumans The Gifted 2017–2019 2 X-Men The Punisher Marvel Cinematic Universe Runaways 3 Cloak & Dagger 2018–2019 2 Helstrom 2020 1 N/A M.O.D.O.K. 2021 Hit-Monkey == Legacy == Since the fold, Marvel Studios has continued to use the name "Marvel Television" as a label for television series within the MCU. == Related pages == * List of television series based on Marvel Comics publications * Marvel Animation * Marvel Comics * Marvel Entertainment * Marvel Studios == References == Category:Marvel Comics
title: Marvel Television
